website_summaries.verdict: A few quirks aside, it's worth considering if you need a small guitar headphone amp that delivers a nice "rock" sound.
pros: Earns praise by guitar players for producing clear, "metal" sound, and being easy to use
Small design makes it highly portable
cons: Plastic construction feels flimsy, and the bass it produces isn't very rich
A few complaints of short battery life

customer_reviews.title: Video Review!!!
customer_reviews.text: Watch it and its unboxing video in higher quality on my Youtube channel: skyforce95
customer_reviews.author: skyforce95

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headphone Amp
customer_reviews.text: Good quality brand at a reasonable price. Three small dials for volume, tone and gain with an FX switch to provide a nice range of sounds. Battery operated, easy to use and perfect for "quiet" practice. Overall just what I was looking for in a plug-in headphone amp. The 'Classic Rock' model works/sounds great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product ... to reduce the likelihood of breakage, put a 1/4 in leader cable on it, with a gender changer if necessary, rather than plugging it directly into the guitar. Otherwise you can fairly easily break off the plug in the guitar jack.
customer_reviews.author: FHW3

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for New bass players
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for someone learning to play Bass Guitar who may have a family, or live in an apartment complex with noise restrictions. The IPod connector works great, but i have been using it to plug into my Laptop and playing songs through youtube and looking up chord sheets at the same time. It also has a drum machine for practicing with a few different drum beats. Going to buy a couple more to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: M. Caouette

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding headphone amp that I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing guitar for 44 years and most of the time, I have used Fender tube amps. I have always preferred a clean, non overdriven tone with reverb. For something to use for practicing at night, or in a setting where I cannot play through a live Amp, this really fits the bill. When run through a pair of headphones, I can get tones reminiscent of my old Fender amps with shimmering reverb. It really is VERY clean. If you are looking for overdrive or distortion, check out the other Amplugs. If you want an ultra clean tone with either reverb, delay, or chorus, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W. Van Mark

customer_reviews.title: I liked the sound so instead of getting rid of it
customer_reviews.text: It worked for 2-3 days and then stopped. I liked the sound so instead of getting rid of it, I decided to replace it and get the new one (lead electric guitar again). Guess what?! It worked for 2-3 days playing 2-3 hours/day and stopped again. I'm returning it though decided to order it again, the same one. 3rd and the last time! I will update my review if I get lucky this time. Update: it didn't work. The same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: The headphone jack does not provide a secure connection and worse still, the electronics are starting to short out
customer_reviews.text: Have to agree with those pointing out the manufacturing deficiencies of this product. Produces a decent sound if uses with quality headphones but within a few months and minimal use it is already malfunctioning. The headphone jack does not provide a secure connection and worse still, the electronics are starting to short out. The signal cuts out while playing after a few minutes and the unit won't turn back on. Changing batteries seemed to help for about a day or so then it went right back to doing the same thing. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie LeMaster

customer_reviews.title: Every guitarist should have one of these
customer_reviews.text: Everybody needs one of these. I use it for travel or when my family begs me to stop playing. I connect my phone to it to play music through the amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Auby

customer_reviews.title: Received used
customer_reviews.text: I bought previously VOX CLEAN and it came in factory packaging (carton + plastic buble) with batteries packed is sealed plastic protector. This one (VOX BASS) came wrapped in plain plastic bag with batteries already installed. It works, but I feel it is not right to send returned or used items. I won't bother to send it back, but have to give one star.
customer_reviews.author: Jerzy Z Potopowicz

customer_reviews.title: Nifty!
customer_reviews.text: Ya this thing is pretty cool and i think it sounds good. I really like the drum rythyms built in, they sound like drums not that cheesy stupid electronic drum sound weve all heard before. Three gain setting, volume tone and tempo adjustment pretty much it. The batteries that come with it are like the ones that come in your new t.v's remote, non alkaline chinese ones probably wont last long. I like this unit its....nifty!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Herman

customer_reviews.title: 1 weak link makes an otherwise good product useless junk.
customer_reviews.text: The headphone plug seems to be the weak link for this mini amp. After only 1 week of occasional use, it stopped transmitting to the left ear. I opened the unit and found one of the plug's mounting feet has become detached and ripped some of the circuitry.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: It's OK, but the one I got seemed to be a return.
customer_reviews.text: It was obviously used when I got it. It had dead batteries installed and came with the generic AAA batteries - which had almost no life left in them. Packaging was worn. Performance of the device was spotty at best. It would work for a few minutes and then just shut off. I was really disappointed. I almost returned immediately, but a pair of new batteries and it seems to be functional. Word of warning - get it plugged in and turned on BEFORE you put the headphones on. The price your ears pay for accidentally touching the tip of the 1/4" plug is steep. Ouch. Ears still ringing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: cheap and malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good but the delay stopped working within an hour. I've seen more durable plastic come out of a happy meal and it could easily snap off the rotating plug sitting on a couch. It's worth maybe $20, not $40.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Woot

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected. Get good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. It’s not studio quality sound but it’s worlds above what I was used to growing up in the late 90s. You will need a good set of headphones though. Because it will sound like crap with standard ear buds or low quality headphones. I use it for practicing when my daughter is asleep. The line in works awesome so you can play along with a song or backing track. The only downside is you can’t see the controls because it plugs directly into the guitar. But once you get a feel for them you don’t need to see.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic G

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: The sound is terrible. The headphone connection was tentative at best. I never figured out how to adjust the tempo on the built-in drum tracks and it broke after the 3rd time using it. Granted, it broke due to my error but it was flimsy to begin with. $45 lesson - if it seems like it might be junk, even if the reviews are good, it's probably junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joe E

customer_reviews.title: Nice little product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to practice playing my bass without disturbing others. It works great! Attach your headphones, plug it into your bass, turn it on, adjust the volume and tone, and you're good to go! I like the option of the aux to play my iPhone through it so you can play along to music. The tone cranked up is too hissy, but turn it down, and it works well. I use a pair of iPhone headphones and the sound is OK with those. I'd like to hear the difference with better headphones. Nice accessory to have and well priced for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: tfigs121

customer_reviews.title: U2, Pink Floyd played with amazing results
customer_reviews.text: I used this to plug in to my home stereo through Bose speakers and was able to use the delay effect for U2’s “Pride” (in the name of love) and Pink Floyd’s “Run Like Hell”. Bottom line...if you’re just starting out, you need nothing more than this, a set of headphones and an aux cord if you want to use actual speakers. It sounds surprisingly well. The effects are not adjustable, you’ll have to work with what you’re given. Ideal customer: every guitarist who travels and wants to practice on the road. College student looking for a small cheap rig to amplify through computer speakers or something similar that actually sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: em

customer_reviews.title: The AP2CL 2 is the best Amplug yet
customer_reviews.text: The AP2CL 2 is the best Amplug yet. I didn't LOVE the old ones. Having effects really helps prevent ear fatigue. I believe we tend to turn it up louder if we just hear a dry signal. I little delay or reverb gives you some virtual distance that helps. That being said, I REALLY wish the effects allowed some sort of blend level. They all sound great, but need to be less "wet" most of the time. That is the only reason I give it only 4 stars. The mode that allows a little dirt is just the right amount for me too.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Bowers

customer_reviews.title: GREAT practice amp !
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Amplug version - I've owned the old 'Twin' version for a couple years, now, but I like this 'Blues' version better ... while they are both great practice tools, this newer 'Blues' version beats out the 'Twin' with a better overdrive/crunch ... it also has the Twin's 'chorus' effect, while adding both 'reverb',and 'echo' effects ... the swivel-plug is a nice improvement, as well ... plug in your music player, and play along with it, too ...
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: it's a good unit, looks pretty cool too
customer_reviews.text: it's a good unit, looks pretty cool too. if i were to make a suggestion to VOX, it would be to build-in a wireless receiver instead of the analog aux-in. it would be one less wire and not as bulky as i have it depicted below. but over all, i'm happy 😊
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Janaslani

customer_reviews.title: Very good practice tool, great sound!
customer_reviews.text: This reminds me of the old Rockman. Its perfect for practicing, you don't need to mess with cables or pedals you can just plug in and go. The effects are nice and provide different tone options. There is no hum, or any other unwanted noise. The dials are for gain, tone, and master volume. It may be asking a bit much, but I wish there was a dial for effect intensity. The reverb in particular is just too much for most playing, maybe one or two songs would sound good. I highly recommend, and I am certain I will be purchasing another one. Maybe phaser or flanger, more metal.
customer_reviews.author: buzznutz modz

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase, does everything I need. I like to play along with audio from the laptop, easy to connect and wear headphones for practice. It's not crazy loud, i.e. it won't boost your bass guitar signal super loud, but certainly adequate. I plug mine right into the output of one of my effect pedals, and it works great. You have to hold the power button in for a half-second to turn it on/off, to prevent accidentally turning it on in your pocket. It came with two cheap AAA batteries, we'll see how long the battery life is with some duracells once those die.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival, No Sound
customer_reviews.text: Classic Rock Unit came dead on arrival. The power light would turn on, and change through the 3 effects, but no sound at all. Plugged this into 3 guitars and nothing. Guitars all played fine through my regular amp. You might get a dead one.
customer_reviews.author: RamZ27

customer_reviews.title: Good bass response, but a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: Although very usable and a great portable solution, I am disappointed with the hiss from this amp. I would expect a solid state amp to have a clean sound. It is not as noticeable when the auxiliary input is in use, but is distracting when just playing. I tried it in two basses at different levels of gain, and could not dramatically reduce the noise. Still... for the price and features, it's a decent product.
customer_reviews.author: preset1

customer_reviews.title: Great, if it works...
customer_reviews.text: I've used amp sparingly since I got it, which was two months ago. I really liked it until a week ago when it just plain quit. Seeing I hadn't used it that much I didn't think it could be the batteries but I changed them anyway, and sure enough, it started working. Today I tried using it again and this time it has zero audio. There is no audio from the guitar nor the aux input. Too late to return. I would not recommend this item. Honestly, this was a very good product when it worked. I did contact VOX and they are sending me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: rdgit

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Today - No Sound - Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Vox Blues Amplug unit arrived today. Opened up the package. Put batteries in. Plugged into guitar. Turned unit on - light comes on. No sound. Checked volume settings in various positions, checked tone, checked gain. No go. Checked guitar volume knobs - nothing. Checked guitar w/ different amp, works. Tried unit with different guitar. No sound. Lemon. Returning. Too bad, seemed like it was worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Great practice tool to use without bothering anyone around you
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that this product allows me to practice using my bose headphones without having to disturb the surroundings in my household. I plug the audio out into my computer and play along with Youtube videos. It works great. I haven't fiddled much with the accompanying built-in rhythms but I did turn it on once to listen and it works great. I just wish that the rectangular box that it's assembled in conforms with the body (maybe make a curvier design so that it doesn't stick out much). I find it always getting in the way when I place my guitar on its stand.
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: Total no-brainer for$40 shipped...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Clean version and connected my Mexi-Strat through the VOX Amplug 2>Fishman preamp> Fender Acoustisonic Junior. Adjusting the VOX to the overdrive channel and playing with the VOX units Gain, Volume and Tone settings - and applying just a tad of the Fender's onboard effects- gives me the chimey tube breakup Neal Schon "Lights" sound I was looking for. It's shockingly good. I can also coax Wes Montgomery cleans out of it, on the Clean amp setting, with the gain down and master cranked. Pushing the Acoustisonic past 2 will wake the dead. As the other reviews note, don't expect it to withstand milspec level drops or road tour treatment.... Total no-brainer for $40 shipped....
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: What a great little headphone amp! I can't even tell you how much I wish I had something like this back when I was touring with my band (90s). What a great practice resource. The drive sound is amazing and it balances the input from your phone/mp3 player very well. My only issue is that I am colorblind and the mode indicator is an LED light that is either orange, red, or yellow. I can't tell the difference between them. Also, it would be good if it had a clean channel, but you can dial back on the guitar volume to get clean enough. After all, it's just for practice and quiet time playing anyway. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: G. MCDONALDTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound optimized for metal - designers did great
customer_reviews.text: Wow! First thing I did is plugged in an active 9-string, expecting horrible sound. What I got was instant equivalent of turning knobs for hours and putting a 10-band equalizer and noise suppressor into FX chain of a real triple rectifier. Of course way more definition could be achieved with the tube amp, but for a tiny portable thing you use for practice, the sound is great. Roland microcube is much bigger but sounds dead, ugly and hard to control by comparison. Added bonus is you can plug this into your car stereo like a phone if you get the right cable, so you can jam loud while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Valeriy N.

customer_reviews.title: EVERY BASS/GUITAR PLAYER NEEDS THIS
customer_reviews.text: probably one of the greatest toys any guitar player can have. Being able to play without bothering anyone and have amazing sound with a decent pair of headphones is invaluable. I wish I had this years ago as it increases practice time and also makes it fun. I use it with my compressor and flanger preamp and get an amazing sound on my warwick 5 string. Probably will need to upgrade headphones soon. Also it is really easy to connect your phone or another output source to jam along with your favorites. BUY ONE NOW !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works great, cheapest quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I give it 4 stars, could've been 5 had it been made with the level of quality you would think would come at this price (not high end but not cheap either). The entire casing is the cheapest plastic you could imagine, feels very hollow and so fragile you toddler might break it if he or she steps on it, and that is no joke. Outside of this pitiful housing quality the item works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony J

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: With this I could play clean and distorted. In fact I could play Thunderstruck purely by hammer ons. Practice with the effects of an amp etc as loud as you wish. I have another one for bass. I own amps but this is nice when you don’t want to turn them on but want to hear yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Lackenbauer

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, wish it worked well.
customer_reviews.text: The bean counters need to be driven from the building, on this re-design. The concept is great, but cheap switches, cheap controls, the plastic casing keeps clunking up against my guitars. The unit works fairly well, when you finally get it tweaked properly, but I'd have gladly paid twice as much for a unit with better quality controls and ergonomics. Who wants this thing denting the body of their Fender ? Just make one with good quality switches and controls, with some padding, us fussy bitches, with 1200$ guitars, somehow don't want our instruments mangled, by 35$ techno. Go figure...
customer_reviews.author: william mcewan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a little powerhouse! I have recently been looking for alternatives to amps for the sake of my housemates. I thought I would take a crack with one of these, which was an awesome choice. This amPlug has an great sound quality when paired with my eight string. All strings are very clear and has depth. Just as a cherry on top, it came with built in effects that really make practice fun. For the price and the quality, you would be foolish to not give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: Z.A. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, but way overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is a pretty straight forward review. Bottom line: - Sounds great - Cool effects options - Extremely cheap construction. You are paying top dollar for the VOX brand name and that's it. The quality of manufacture is on par with a toy out of one of those gumball machines that they have at the mall. No, I'm not exaggerating. This is hands down the most poorly constructed, cheapest plastic thing I've ever paid more than a dollar for. Luckily it sounds good, but the quality vs. price is downright insulting. - Don't sneeze near this thing or it'll probably disintegrate.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: 13 months then what happened? Recap
customer_reviews.text: I was just finding time to enjoy this thing. Amazing when it worked. It began to fade so I switched out the batteries with no luck. Different guitar, no luck. New phones, same... Keep posted I hope to end this with happy news. Good News! Thanks VOX. One month beyond warranty they issued me a replacement. Most reviews are positive, so maybe I had the rare defect. I did an autopsy and discovered a broken wire inside where the 1/4" audio plug pivots. Broken at the solder joint. So I updated my rating to 3 stars. I'm still afraid the wire in the new one will break on me. That part of the design might rate a rethink.
customer_reviews.author: Urban

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart ten minutes after using it
customer_reviews.text: The item literally fell apart about 5 minutes after I started using it. Man I really wanted this for a practice amp. Why doesn't someone make one of these with an aluminum housing yet? I mean come on it even came with a warning for different ways it could break. I thought for sure VOX would of had this locked up!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Charles Frank

customer_reviews.title: sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others that it feels cheap (reason for 4 stars vs 5)....HOWEVER, it's got great sound. I have the Metal version and it's got nice distortion. I really just got this as a way to play quietly (in the house) and not be tied to an amp, and it's perfect for that. Nice crunchy distortion - not as much control as a pedal, obviously, but enough for it to be a lot of fun. Haven't plugged in any auxiliary items yet to see how that sound works with the guitar input, but will get there.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The best Headphone Amp for Bass.
customer_reviews.text: This product sounds the best compare to others on the market. However, I found that it's easy to break. So I had to replace it. (But I had the device insurance, so it was free) I found the best way to use it is with an extension cable into your bass, not plugging it directly into your bass. Leaving in the bass, I would hit it on things and it would twist around and the cable would yank on it. Now I leave it on my desk and run a cable to it. Yes, I have wires all over the place, but its better than breaking the thing again.
customer_reviews.author: walter bacon

customer_reviews.title: Amaing Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: I played Upright Bass (for an Orchestra) for quite a long time. One day my friend tosses me a bass guitar and says "play". So after learning how to read tabs (it's not hard) I could play along. Well my buddy loaned me the bass to practice at home and I bought this little device to practice without bothering anyone else (not to mention this is cheaper than an amp). It's wonderful. Easy to use and it can lay an aux input over the bass so you can play along to songs easily.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Reisch

customer_reviews.title: ONLY AN AMP
customer_reviews.text: So totally my fault, but the little sucker looked like a speaker that you plug into your guitar. Now that I KNOW that it isn't, for its purposes, it works fine. BUT in my defense, you can't argue that the bottom half of the device appears to resemble a speaker. Well done VOX marketing team! You win this round. Just wish it WAS a speaker so I didn't have to use cords (Chords are acceptable (see what I did there)) on my traveler guitar. I don't know why I even bother writing a review. It's not like a picture person like me will read this anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small portable amp
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to play my bass in the basement through headphones since I miss my 810 cabinet. I was skeptical of this little unit, but it performs well and sounds very good. I am not sure of the sturdiness of the construction, but with some care this should not have many problems. It is plastic throughout. I am rather amazed by the sound quality this puts out, however. Definitely enjoyable and a good purchase for basement rockers who do not want to wake the family up.
customer_reviews.author: tonybill

customer_reviews.title: I am very impressed with the sound
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this tiny headphone amp would not be able to deliver big sound through my headphones, but WOW, was I surprised!! I love this device. It works great with my electric guitar, and I also tried it on a musical instrument that uses a piezo pickup and it sounded awesome. I am buying another for a bass guitar, and one for a gift. That should tell you how impressed I am with this little gem. There is a great youtube video comparing all of these Vox mini amps, and it was really helpful for me to decide which ones I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: TFaC

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly what I expected very well
customer_reviews.text: I practice with this, and a set of head phones whenever I need to be relatively quiet, in a noisy place with others. It works fine with my baritone ukulele and my ukulele bass. I can't think of anything I would change to improve it. it fits easily in with all the junk in the compartment of my Ukulele case. Its connectors rotate to adapt to your position so your cords are not stressed. It's basicly just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: The new design with rotating plug and mutiple effects is just wonderful. Great clean sound
customer_reviews.text: A repeat customer for Voix Amplugs. The new design with rotating plug and mutiple effects is just wonderful. Great clean sound, and good mild distortion and effects (chorus, flange, reverb). Works wonderful on headphones for private practice, and drives a portable speaker for the smallest travel gig setup ever. I use it for both solid body and AE guitars.
customer_reviews.author: dontfret

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for quick setup & travel.  Use the mp3 input to play along with streaming media
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient for reducing the number of cords when don't have time for lengthy setup. I almost always use the mp3 input so I can play along with streaming media from my phone or tablet. Vox sounds better than the cheaper ones, but took one star off since the plug WILL break after a while, no matter how careful you are. Use a guitar stand so the VOX doesn't touch the ground, or unplug it every time you have to set that guitar aside for a moment. Perhaps a bit more pricey than it could be, but fits the bill as headphone OR amplified effects unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I had the first gen of this product, and it lacked the drums and was twice the price. This a great value. The tone knob seems to mostly just add hiss, but even with the tone rolled off, it is clear and punchy. The swivel jack is great. This is a must have for those who want an easy way to learn songs, or just wander around the house jamming out. The guitar versions are really great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey HughesTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great for practicing late at night...
customer_reviews.text: ... Or whenever you don't want to disturb folks. I got the "clean" version to practice jazz guitar, and it has a good clean sound. Just a bit of background his, but I don't notice that when I play. I've also used the play-through feature to practice with tracks, such as Aebersold recordings or iReal Pro. It does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: David Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mobile guitar headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: Overall I do not see a better mobile solution. The unit sounds excellent. I did get lots of hum using some cell phone earbuds, which was best reduced by upping the guitar's volume control and this mini amps input gain control. BUT, once I switched to my Sennheiser headphones the hum problem largely went away. I would agree this unit is likely fragile and needs careful handling as it is lightly constructed of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: so I don't recommend it for noisy environments
customer_reviews.text: Well, it does work as a headphone amp, but honestly, I was expecting a bit more quality for a VOX product. The sound is not loud and if you set the gain high it distorts the sound, so I don't recommend it for noisy environments. Besides that, the quality of the circuitry seems poor as there is a constant audible hiss which only attenuates setting the tone fully towards the bass end. Furthermore, the feel in the hand is kind of cheap and definitely not as what you guess from the pictures. Overall, it does what it is supposed to do, but I found it a bit pricey just for being a VOX branded product.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Just blown away by this thing
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up once we got our stay at home order for Corona. I didn't expect much out of this thing but I'm having a blast with it. With good headphones plugged in it sounds like the real thing. You can also plug a stereo or pc speakers into it if you don't want to wear headphones. I am so happy with this little Amp. I can shred without bugging anyone in the house. Perfect for apartments or shared spaces.
customer_reviews.author: blender kitties

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Broken in 2 days, worked great for a few hours, then went to use it again and the plug pushed into the plastic housing and would not stay plugged into the guitar socket. Pulled the plug out of the plastic but it's loose now and cannot get it in to jack, also getting loud hum in the headphones now. Don't waste your money. Flimsy plastic junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! Awesome to play with.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I got the “Clean” one for Christmas and went back for the “Blues.” I found this product just looking for a way to plug in headphones directly into a guitar. I recommend this for any guitarist. Something about a great sound that keeps me wanting to play for hours. Battery life seems to last a while, depends on how much you play and how loud. I advise checking out some YouTube comparisons between the different models. Eventually, I’d love to collect them all. Maybe when I up my musical skills a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Size but extremely buzzy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it advertises but mine has a huge amount of buzz and hum that wouldn't go away without turning the volume and tone almost completely off. I thought it was my bass but even unplugged and shielded it sounds like a cartoon tesla tower. After two weeks, I just went out and bought a cheap practice amp. Would be good for practicing quietly on the road but other than that just not great. Maybe it will get better if I try another bass but right now unusable.
customer_reviews.author: P. Puckhaber

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product that totally exceeded its expected value. Needed to have a way to practice late at night without bothering wife/kids. Not only does this device do precisely that, it has GREAT extra benefits. The ability to alter the sound similarly to amp combo is a huge plus. You can actually get dirty sounds like a blues guitar or run it clean. The plug rotates so it fits angle plugs like my Strat. Fantastic product that is available at a screaming good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amador

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tiny Amp!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been watching this product for a couple of years, and knew that I'd buy one once I finally bought my 1st bass guitar! I am sooo glad I did. Buy it, and you will see why... just buy it! Highly recommend it! Watch out for the cheaper ones, they may look good on paper, but the quality may not be there. For me, Vox sort of stands alone with this particular practice headphone amp. It's just Great!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: Recently decided to upgrade to a new guitar, and in order to test out the guitars without hauling all my equipment into the stores, I bought this little guy. Great clean sound for comparing pickups. The unit also has reverb and delay and a crunch setting. This is also great for practicing quietly in headphones. Sounds great with my acoustic/electric as well, especially with reverb. Nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: It sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a bassist for many years and appreciate being able to practice or create when the urge hits. The Vox amp plug allows for this, also with the built in drums an ability to choose a couple of different useable patterns as will as the bpm adjustment, makes for a great bass line writing tool. And for the beginning bass player it gets you the feel of working with a drummer and not just a metronome. Metronomes are great, but the real magic is locking in with the drummers kick drum. I would and have recommend this to others looking for away to practice quietly. Rob bass player for 49 years
customer_reviews.author: RT SLINGER

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a cheap piece of plastic, sounds like anything but that
customer_reviews.text: At first sight/feel this appears to be some junky plastic toy. That couldn't be farther from the truth. The sound this thing creates is amazing. Super clean cleans, warm crunchy gain, a couple of decent effects. Somehow it really sounds like a tube amp. I got the AC30, and I'd highly recommend. Don't skimp on the headphones though - I use the Sony MDR 7506s. Combined, I doubt you'll get a better sound out of a headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Montana

customer_reviews.title: Great for Practice
customer_reviews.text: I have used the original version for bass and bought this newer one recently. It is an even better sound for bass. It's a nice and full sound with a little grit so you can get some articulation. The tone is fairly adjustable as well. These are great little devices for practicing along with a recording. The built in drum beats are nice as well. They are pretty full sounding percussion that will inspire you to make up nice little parts on your own. It's perfect for practice and has helped me improve my playing through the years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R Burchett

customer_reviews.title: EVERY GUITARIST NEEDS THIS!
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't completely sure what to expect, since it is only about $30 and I could barely find and video reviews of it. As soon as I played my first notes with this, I was amazed at how powerful this little amp was. Its great how it can be clean or distorted (with high gain) and how it also has tremelo, chorus, delay, and reverb effects. If you don't want to wear headphones then you can plug in a small speaker and put it in your pocket. Overall, if you play guitar and you don't want to be glued to your amp, BUY THIS! You won't regret it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Davidson

customer_reviews.title: good for quiet pratice
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I bought the classic rock amplug. It,s ok, but not great. I tried it with 5 different Gibson Les Paul (Standard, traditional, 2 classics, and a studio tribute) it sounded okay but not great. For the money, I think it is good for traveling or late night. It sort of sounded like playing through a transistor radio. At home, I think I will just plug my headphones into my amp.
customer_reviews.author: scottatgc

customer_reviews.title: Buy this. Play anytime, anywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Surpassed my expectations. Excellent amp. Super convenient, you will wind up playing your guitar a lot more frequently. Effects-- The reverb sounds nice. The chorus is meh. It does do some high gain distortion on one of the emulated amps. Aux input so you can play along with a jam track or learn a song was unexpectedly useful. Pros-- sounds great, really convenient, batteries last about 5-6 hours. Cons--Batteries last 5-6 hours and you will use this thing a lot. Because it is awesome. Not rechargeable. Uses 2 AAA batteries. You will need to get some rechargeable AAAs.
customer_reviews.author: Señor Tenebroso

customer_reviews.title: Great for silent prictice!
customer_reviews.text: Like others said, this product doesn't have the most solid build quality, but it's a great deal for the price. Very good tone, adequate volume and mixing controls. The built in drum beats are also helpful and useful. Best feature: I can practice more, at a nice volume, and play along with all the tunes on my phone (over 4500), without bothering anyone else in the household!
customer_reviews.author: R. Hermann

customer_reviews.title: Very good portable practice device
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that you do not need a lead cord to hear your bass and you can practice anywhere. Volume output is more than adequate for practicing. Ability to plug in another music/sound source is great. Appreciated the built in metronome and basic drum beats. The overall sound from the unit is ok as there is a slight hiss when you turn up the volume to a decent listening level. The build quality could also be improved. Overall for the money would recommend this product for practice purposes only.
customer_reviews.author: Roy C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Practice Device
customer_reviews.text: Have been very satisfied. I tried the one for guitar with my bass, it sounded good, but ordered the one made for the bass. It has a much better sound for the bass. It is a must have practice device especially if you do not want to interrupt others around you while you are practicing or just jamming to some tunes. I do recommend getting a good quality set of headphones to use with this.
customer_reviews.author: Monty Batchelor

customer_reviews.title: Very Fragile
customer_reviews.text: When it wasn't broken this was an awesome thing. You could practice anywhere without having to lug your amp around. But as I was sitting on the sofa, I barely nudged it and it broke. This thing needs to be made out of better material before asking someone to pay $45.
customer_reviews.author: jettisonbrains

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third different one purchased. Very small and convenient to use. Sounds great, is versatile, and can be utilized with headphones or plugged into an amplifier or a mixing board. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Randazzo

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great, great features and good quality item.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself performs very well and serves its purpose. I believe I just received a defective unit because when I plugged it into my acoustic-electric the unit swivels continuously at the plugin port, which the manufacturer confirmed it should not do. So I just returned the item for a refund, which was done the same day that I dropped it off at The UPS Store, Extremely Impressed!!!
customer_reviews.author: DM BOND

customer_reviews.title: HOLY SHXXXXT
customer_reviews.text: This is it, a total masterpiece for what it does. Three rig types, three sweet effects, gain that blasts, tone that actually works, great volume and style overall. One of the best things I have paid for, ever, period. I chug, I hammer-on, I palm mute, and this thing keeps up no problem. I got really expensive aaa's and I have only ran through a few sets. I shall bow to my sensay, thanks VOX!
customer_reviews.author: ZVevil

customer_reviews.title: I'm definitely a fan
customer_reviews.text: Just plugged it in to my Studio Les Paul and gave it a first go 'round the block. Found it a little glitchy just on the connection into the guitar - perhaps it MUST be rotated somewhat in order to close the circuit. I really like the effects included. The sound is good. The volume is great. Operation is pretty straightforward. I know I will get a lot of use out of this. I'd definitely buy it as a gift for anyone learning the instrument because it will not only give others peace-ishness, it will encourage a learner to play.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: reverb and delay effects make this a big improvement over the first generation which I also loved. This is a very handy and practical practice ...
customer_reviews.text: The tremolo, reverb and delay effects make this a big improvement over the first generation which I also loved. This is a very handy and practical practice tool. With the auxiliary input you can jam right along with the song you are learning, and sound right in the mix, very useful. It also surprisingly fun to be cord-free, walking around outside or wherever strikes your fancy. Run the headphone out to an MP3 boombox or stereo input and you have an amp. Run it into a recording device and you are instantly recording without a mic and room dynamics. This is lots of fun, a great value given how much I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Bought the Clean
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try the Clean with my acoustic guitar that has a built-in pickup and controls to try to get some different effects thru a headset. Works OK to do that much. I don't usually have to wear my reading glasses when I play my guitar, but had to when using the Clean to see its tiny markings on the Gain, Tone,and Volume controls. My Clean also freely spins around on its guitar phone jack making seeing and adjusting its controls sometimes awkward. I personally found it kind of a hassle to use and for that reason gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet
customer_reviews.text: This item provides a nice tone, letting me hear the sound of my bass without much alteration. The problem this thing has is that the maximum volume is far too low. I had hoped to use this for playing along with recordings (via the AUX input) in order to learn the bass lines. Unfortunately, due to the low volume, I have to reduce the volume of the external sound source so much, in order to not completely bury my own playing, that I cannot actually hear the bass parts from the recording.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Osborne

customer_reviews.title: A delightful piece of equipment well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: The amPlug 2 Blues edition successfully met my expectations...and then some! The unit has a dynamic, pristine overdrive that gives you what you want when you want it. I did not want distortion - I wanted overdrive...and the amPlug 2 Blues edition delivers it. There are three separate drive channels, as well as, chorus, delay and reverb effects with varying preset degrees of depth. Overall, I definitely recommend this unit and would buy it again. Great performance. Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: southsidesmoka

customer_reviews.title: You're Welcome Neighbors?
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works great to shield my neighbors from my horrid bass playing skills. While I don't get the same apartment shaking, heart stopping, waking up at 2 am like its an earth quake rumble; it sounds just as good in my headphones. I miss the feeling of my bass but my neighbors don't and I won't get evicted now; so I guess I'll just have to get good enough to play in public so I can feel that sweet low end again.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Nagy

customer_reviews.title: It will allow you to play on the go.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds like crap compared to a regular amp, but if for some reason you need the portability of this device it will allow you to play on the go. I'm not sure it is fair to give this only 3 stars over the audio quality. It should be obvious this isn't going to sound great, but if I can buy a portable music player at the same size capable of playing 'hi-res' audio, why does something like this have to sound so bad?
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The blues version is great
customer_reviews.text: This exceeded my expectations. You can get a wide variety of tones from clean to warm to scorching from this little guy. It's able to drive large studio cans, too. The effects are pretty good although not editable. Simple is good. It's well worth the price. I'll probably pick up the bass version. The construction is adequate but would probably not survive much abuse.
customer_reviews.author: jeremym

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Thank you so much! ❤️
customer_reviews.text: This little babe is perfect! My 12 year old son has an electric guitar, and not only does this product SOUND fantastic, it gives him that amplified sound minus the noise level of a real amp (we’re in an apt building; gotta be courteous with neighbors). He also loves that he can plug in his head phones to hear himself and walk around our home playing. :) It’s pocket sized, light weight, no cords needed. Eazy peezy 🍋 squeezy!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Nice practice companion, could use an even more flexible plug, tho.
customer_reviews.text: A good practice companion, and this version provides a beat to play with! I use it with an NS Designs 5-string cello (w/ low F string) and headphones of choice. One thing it needs is a dongle so it would be compatible w/ instrument designs where the plug is rearward-facing. I use a 90-degree plug to connect w/ my amp, so need an adapter for this to work w/ my instrument, even with its ability to swivel a bit. However, this offers me a nice range of settings for playing to myself in a hotel room, late at night, etc. :)
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Hennessey

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from the old - Includes batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Great update from the old Vox Metal amplug. The swivel jack really adds the final touch. It lets your headphone jack hang down naturally unlike he first version. Also was pleased to see it came with the batteries needed! No real sound different I can tell from the old amp but I could be wrong since my old amp has been broken for a while. This thing packs a punch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: For such a small profile this thing rocks. I have one for Bass and one for AC 30. The bass unit is amazing and you can't beat the convenience! If I want to play some bass the hardest part is getting out of my chair. I keep it already hooked up with headphones. I would imagine the quality of the cans is relative to the output. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fun little headphone amp, sounds great and super convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful practice headphone amp for those times you need to practice quietly. The sound is great, and it is much better than plugging into an amp and being restricted by the headphone and amp cords. I like the sound, it is mostly pretty clean but there are some minimal effects and you can bump up the gain to get a dirtier sound, if that is what you are looking for. It won't replace pedals or a modeling amp, but it is the type of sound I was looking for anyway.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: simple and reliable practice amp
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an older model (METAL) i liked it as a practice amp but it had limited effects range. This one is a big improvement. It has Delay, Reverb and chorus effects each with three settings. It also has one completely useless feature a Tremolo effect in 3 settings. one of the settings i guess i could use but the other two tremolo settings are way too slow and would make any but the most trippy strummer song sound completely out of whack. If instead of tremolo they had a different additional effect i would have rated it 5 out of 5. Overall its a pretty good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: carlos vicente

customer_reviews.title: REally really well made and great sounding.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Using it with a Kala U-Bass which I ALSO really recommend. I should clarify that I am using it with the Bose Tone Match mixer and the Bose L1 Tower PA. I'm also using it with a little JBL Charge2 (since they went on sale so drastically--what a great speaker). It looks good. Folds up nicely. Surprised by the built in drum sounds so I can practice my Bass lines with ease. Convenient. Gonna buy another one for my regular ISA uke.
customer_reviews.author: P. WillifordTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound at an Unbeatable Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gadget as a gift for a friend's son, who is learning to play electric guitar. Both were thrilled that he can now wail away in relative silence without shaking the pictures off the walls. I managed to grab it away from him for a few minutes, and (playing out of a strat into high-end over-the-ear headphones) was very impressed with the dynamic range of its tone control and the quality of its built-in suite of basic effects (chorus, reverb, delay). Mini-plug Aux input allows play-along, which is useful for learning songs. Solidly built; intuitive controls. A very good value for the $$.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical. How could a cheap plastic box ever sound good? I was amazed at the sound. The various settings and reverb effects allowed me to get a great sound. The aux jack let's you plug in your own tunes and practice along. I'm even using a $19 set of headphones. I can only imagine what some top end phones sound like. This is a must for any metal guitar player that wants to live in peace and harmony with their neighbors while still shredding at 2am.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Brown

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this thing - great "metal" sound...lots of options - reverb, etc...
customer_reviews.text: I also own a VOX AC30, but really couldn't get the "metal" sound I wanted. I'm still a novice guitar player at best, but am having a ton of fun with this and some old Testament tracks. Like the AUX input so I can watch/listen to Jamplay while I'm learning and playing along - especially at night while my kids are sleeping...
customer_reviews.author: RevisionX

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to practice without bothering the rest of the house. I did not think I would like this, every headphone amp I have ever tried sounded like transistor garbage. This actually sounds amazing. I can get a nice clean bell tone to a dirty and gritty classic rock tone without sounding fake. I have tried several head phones and they all sound good but some are better than others, my AKG earbuds are my first choice, they let the highs and mids shine. I can now plug in and practice all hours of the day or night.
customer_reviews.author: Poseidon9447

customer_reviews.title: Great for the apartment guitarist or taking your axe outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Great for the apartment guitarist or taking your axe outdoors. The sound is full with plenty of effects options to noodle with. Hand one to a beginner and save your ears while they learn scales. Goes from almost clean to full on distortion soaked in reverb. It's the only one of these I own (so far) so I can't compare them to the other versions.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sollenberger

customer_reviews.title: Good headphone amp for an electric guitar.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent amp that doesn't annoy my neighbors. 3 levels of tremolo: off, "Goldilocks", and "too much". Delay, chorus, and reverb. Volume, tone, and gain. Auxiliary input. Batteries included. I use it with my Squier Strat and it puts a smile on my face. It's passable with a bass guitar as well.
customer_reviews.author: Autodidact

customer_reviews.title: Punchy little surprise.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect much but wanted something to practice with wherever I may be. This little thing is awesome. I've used it with actives and passive. It just sounds good. The only nitpicking thing I'd say is soloing on the high end got a little thin the higher I went... but everywhere else was pretty awesome. Would it compete with a tube stack? No. Is it awesome for noodling with headphones? Yep. And it's a great price.
customer_reviews.author: AMP Guitar Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and size. Gets my vote !!
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST HAVE for any musician who wants additional practice time without disturbing others around you. The aux input allows me to use my iPod for accompaniment and the sound quality is very good for such a small unit. I would recommend this to electric guitarist or bassist needing “private practice time” !!
customer_reviews.author: Roy J. Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Versatile! Outstanding little headset amplifier!
customer_reviews.text: Can't stop playing it. Plenty of tones, very versatile. I pair with my Gold Top or Jaguar and let 'er rip. Playing along to backing tracks on YouTube for soloing practice, this device has provided hours and hours of playing and practice.
customer_reviews.author: Dantebenuto

customer_reviews.title: Nice Backup if Without Power
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea, but admittedly don’t expect too much power. If you want to practice where there’s no plug, then this is a great, inexpensive option. The three gain settings just seem to render decreased volume without too much tonal shift, and this pretty much needs to be played at full volume. There’s a fair amount of background static, but I haven’t yet come across an option that is crystal clear. I ended up buying a headphone extension cable, and just run through my practice amp for more tone.
customer_reviews.author: MO816

customer_reviews.title: Excellent practice tool
customer_reviews.text: I use the Vox Amplug 2 for quiet practice, and it's a great little product for the money. There is a great variety of tones available in such a small package, and its portability and ease of use can't be beat. The effects don't have a wide range of control (just premade settings), but at this size and price point they are a nice feature and better than one would expect. I rarely use them because I can get what I need just through the gain, tone and volume which all adjust far better than I expected. I highly recommend this pocket amp.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Egan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Vox Classic Rock in my bass guitar for a while and figured I would try this to see if I get a more classic bass sound. I don't really. I don't see what is the point of this product as it doesn't really do anything better than the classic rock Vox does. I should've sent it back but it's too late now.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice little device. I often travel for work with a Yamaha THR-10C amp and 6 pedal board in my suitcase. I also bring a Bose ColorLink Bluetooth speaker too. I can take this and play into headphones, or run into the AUX input of the Bluetooth speaker and have the equivalent of a an amp and free up 75% of my suitcase. The sound I like out of it is where the gain is set to around 10%. If you max it out it just sounds like muddy garbage. ...but sounds pretty nice up to about 50%. Even has a cheesy little built-in delay, reverb and chorus which I will probably get by with. Not bad for the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: !m!  !m!

customer_reviews.title: Ibanez owners beware!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this item and let me warn you if you own an Ibanez bass you’re going to have an issue with the plug inserting flush. I contacted Vox and explained the issue I’m having so I’ll see and report back if it’s resolved. Therefore I can’t give a well informed review until I see how Vox handles this issue.
customer_reviews.author: JByrne3

product_meta.title: VOX AP2AC amPlug 2 AC30 Guitar/Bass Headphone Amplifier
product_meta.description: style:AC30Headphone guitar amplifier with 3 amp modes, 9 selectable effects, tremolo circuit, speaker cabinet emulation, and aux in jack.
feature_bullets: Power supply: AAA batteries x 2 (Best with Polaroid AAA batteries)
Dimensions: W x D x H) 3.39 x 3.15 x 1.22" 86 x 80 x 31mm)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,464 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
